Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[TFM Display][Bug] Packages with backslash path didn't show TFM information." (#8995) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
* Added normalization of package entry paths using `FileNameHelper.GetZipEntryPath`.

Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/4220.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Anchor link focus outline makes it hard to read" (#8994) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Describe the bug

On NuGet.org, focusing on an anchor link adds a fairly thick outline which makes it hard to read the anchor text. For instance, I tabbed on the version listing for `Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection` and here's what that looks like:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/174281/153080150-fd3cf34b-e619-48b7-b94e-17e2ea54ee2a.png)

It'd be nice not to have the text cut-off when focused like so.

### Repro Steps

1. Visit https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection/
2. Keep tabbing until you get to text that is small

### Expected Behavior

Legible text when focused.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Allow case insensitive comparison of X-Frame-Options" (#8993) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed issue "Update to older Package version causes "Object reference not set" error in CodeSpaces" (#10540) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Please read the following information before posting the issue. -->
<!-- If you're having trouble with the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), you are in the right place. -->
<!-- If you're having trouble with the NuGet.org Website, please post in [NuGetGallery issues](http://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues) -->

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | Visual Studio | MSBuild.exe | dotnet.exe): Visual Studio

Product version: 5.9 preview 4

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: ?

## Repro steps and/or sample project

<!-- Please add as much details as possible to help us to reproduce your problem. -->

Telemetry, logs, etc: https://developercommunity2.visualstudio.com/t/update-to-older-package-causes-object-reference-no/1330912

1. Repeat steps from https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/10539
2. Downgrade `Castle.Core 4.4.1` to `4.2.1`.
3. Observe an error in Error List and PMUI.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49205731/106958528-7e84da80-6707-11eb-95cb-f235d2981880.png)

### Verbose Logs

<!-- Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbosity diag | etc...) -->
Telemetry, logs, etc: https://developercommunity2.visualstudio.com/t/update-to-older-package-causes-object-reference-no/1330912

 

>   at NuGet.PackageManagement.VisualStudio.CpsPackageReferenceProject.<>c__DisplayClass18_0.<GetTransitivePackageReferencesForFramework>b__1(ValueTuple`2 t)
>    at System.Linq.Enumerable.FirstOrDefault[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source, Func`2 predicate)
>    at NuGet.PackageManagement.VisualStudio.CpsPackageReferenceProject.GetTransitivePackageReferencesForFramework(NuGetFramework targetFramework, List`1 installedPackages, List`1 transitivePackages, IList`1 targets)
>    at NuGet.PackageManagement.VisualStudio.CpsPackageReferenceProject.<>c__DisplayClass16_0.<GetInstalledAndTransitivePackagesAsync>b__3(TargetFrameworkInformation f)
>    at System.Linq.Enumerable.<SelectManyIterator>d__17`2.MoveNext()
>    at System.Linq.Lookup`2.Create[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source, Func`2 keySelector, Func`2 elementSelector, IEqualityComparer`1 comparer)
>    at System.Linq.GroupedEnumerable`3.GetEnumerator()
>    at System.Linq.Enumerable.WhereSelectEnumerableIterator`2.MoveNext()
>    at System.Collections.Generic.List`1..ctor(IEnumerable`1 collection)
>    at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToList[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source)
>    at NuGet.PackageManagement.VisualStudio.CpsPackageReferenceProject.<GetInstalledAndTransitivePackagesAsync>d__16.MoveNext()
> --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
>    at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)
>    at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
>    at NuGet.PackageManagement.VisualStudio.CpsPackageReferenceProject.<GetInstalledPackagesAsync>d__15.MoveNext()
> --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
>    at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)
>    at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
>    at NuGet.PackageManagement.VisualStudio.NuGetProjectManagerService.<GetInstalledPackagesAsync>d__10.MoveNext()

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Pack icon file in `msbuild /t:pack`" (#8188) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Make sure that, by running `msbuild /t:pack`, you can create nupkgs with icon file inside the package.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Lock file integrity is lost when using floating version in project references" (#10458) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Please read the following information before posting the issue. -->
<!-- If you're having trouble with the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), you are in the right place. -->
<!-- If you're having trouble with the NuGet.org Website, please post in [NuGetGallery issues](http://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues) -->

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | Visual Studio | MSBuild.exe | dotnet.exe): dotnet.exe

Product version: .NET SDK 5.0.102

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: None

## Repro steps and/or sample project

Full sample project is here: https://github.com/shibayan/nuget-lock-demo

```xml
<!-- ClassLibrary1.csproj -->
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">

  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFramework>netcoreapp3.1</TargetFramework>
  </PropertyGroup>

  <ItemGroup>
    <!-- Use floating version -->
    <PackageReference Include="Newtonsoft.Json" Version="12.0.*" />
  </ItemGroup>

</Project>

<!-- FunctionApp1.csproj -->
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">
  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFramework>netcoreapp3.1</TargetFramework>
    <AzureFunctionsVersion>v3</AzureFunctionsVersion>
  </PropertyGroup>
  <ItemGroup>
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask" Version="2.2.0" />
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.NET.Sdk.Functions" Version="3.0.11" />
  </ItemGroup>
  <ItemGroup>
    <!-- Use project reference -->
    <ProjectReference Include="..\ClassLibrary1\ClassLibrary1.csproj" />
  </ItemGroup>
  <ItemGroup>
    <None Update="host.json">
      <CopyToOutputDirectory>PreserveNewest</CopyToOutputDirectory>
    </None>
    <None Update="local.settings.json">
      <CopyToOutputDirectory>PreserveNewest</CopyToOutputDirectory>
      <CopyToPublishDirectory>Never</CopyToPublishDirectory>
    </None>
  </ItemGroup>
</Project>
```

```
> dotnet restore --use-lock-file
> dotnet restore --locked-mode

error NU1004: The packages lock file is inconsistent with the project dependencies so restore can't be run in locked mode. Disable the RestoreLockedMode MSBuild property or pass an explicit --force-evaluate option to run restore to update the lock file.
```

When using floating version in `ClassLibrary1`, it seems that the correct version is not written to the lock file of `FunctionApp1`.

It will be easier to understand if you check the following diffs. `ClassLibrary1` is still at version **12.0.3**, but `FunctionApp1` has updated its lock file to version **12.0.0**.

https://github.com/shibayan/nuget-lock-demo/pull/1/files

### Verbose Logs

<!-- Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbosity diag | etc...) -->

https://github.com/shibayan/nuget-lock-demo/pull/1/checks?check_run_id=1709907720

Events.RelatedBody:
